trans-unit.source: Determines which, if any, of the child windows belonging to the specified parent window contains the specified point

seg-source.mrk: Determines which, if any, of the child windows belonging to the specified parent window contains the specified point

target.mrk: Determines which, if any, of the child windows belonging to the specified parent window contains the specified point

trans-unit.source: $tagPOINT structure that defines the client coordinates (relative to hwndParent) of the point to be checked.

seg-source.mrk: $tagPOINT structure that defines the client coordinates (relative to hwndParent) of the point to be checked.

target.mrk: $tagPOINT structure that defines the client coordinates (relative to hwndParent) of the point to be checked.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The flags that specify which child windows to skip. This parameter can be one or more of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: The flags that specify which child windows to skip.
This parameter can be one or more of the following values:

target.mrk: The flags that specify which child windows to skip.
This parameter can be one or more of the following values:

trans-unit.source: Handle to the first child window. If the point is within the parent window but not within any child window that meets the criteria, the return value is a handle to the parent window. If the point lies outside the parent window, the return value is 0.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the first child window.
If the point is within the parent window but not within any child window that meets the criteria, the return value is a handle to the parent window.
If the point lies outside the parent window, the return value is 0.

target.mrk: Handle to the first child window.
If the point is within the parent window but not within any child window that meets the criteria, the return value is a handle to the parent window.
If the point lies outside the parent window, the return value is 0.

trans-unit.source: The system maintains an internal list that contains the handles of the child windows associated with a parent window.

seg-source.mrk: The system maintains an internal list that contains the handles of the child windows associated with a parent window.

target.mrk: The system maintains an internal list that contains the handles of the child windows associated with a parent window.

trans-unit.source: The order of the handles in the list depends on the Z order of the child windows.

seg-source.mrk: The order of the handles in the list depends on the Z order of the child windows.

target.mrk: The order of the handles in the list depends on the Z order of the child windows.

trans-unit.source: If more than one child window contains the specified point, the system returns a handle to the first window in the list that contains the point and meets the criteria specified by $iFlags.

seg-source.mrk: If more than one child window contains the specified point, the system returns a handle to the first window in the list that contains the point and meets the criteria specified by $iFlags.

target.mrk: If more than one child window contains the specified point, the system returns a handle to the first window in the list that contains the point and meets the criteria specified by $iFlags.
